intro: Leucopsidium texanum, commonly known as Texas blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
